alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 11:01AM EDT until April 07 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 10.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 12.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight to 10.7 feet and begin rising again early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 11.2 feet Friday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
